Gateway: The Northwestern Frontier

From ancient times, India's northwestern frontier (Khyber and Bolan passes) has been a gateway for foreign invaders. While Eastern India was moving towards unification with the rise of Magadha, the Northwest (Gandhara, Kamboja) was divided into small Janapadas that were constantly at war with each other. This political fragmentation invited external powers.

ЁЯТ░
Reasons for Attraction

India's immense wealth and fertile land have always attracted conquerors. Furthermore, political upheavals in Central Asia and Persia also pushed tribes towards India. Persian (Iranian) and Macedonian (Greek) invasions were the beginning of this series, which deeply influenced the history of India.
